div.span: School Closure

All Vestal Schools are CLOSED through May 15, 2020, in response to the coronavirus (COVID-19) by an order from Governor Cuomo issued April 16, 2020. All CSE/504 meetings are suspended during this period of school closure.

a.span: Please click here to visit our COVID-19 & Vestal Home Learning Resources web page

div.span: All Vestal Schools continue to be closed through Friday May 15, per Governor Cuomo in response to the coronavirus (COVID-19).
Please see

a.span: an updated message to our students, families and staff from the Superintendent Office's, dated April 9, regarding the impact of this closure

span.strong: Food Distribution locations for Pick-up Meals

div.span: During the State of Emergency, with schools now closed until May 15, 2020,
children ages 18 and younger can receive multiple
"grab & go" meals.
Here is the of

a.span: locations, dates and times for April 13 - 17

div.span: . Please note, for families picking up at African Road Elementary, the meals will be handed out in the parking lot by the auditorium entrance. In Tioga County, the "Grab & Go" meal site is the Apalachin Fire Station, 230 Pennsylvania Avenue, with Grab & Go meals distributed April 13 - 17 on Mondays & Thursdays, 10 a.m. - 1 p.m. and 4 - 6 p.m.
Please feel free to go to the site closest to you no matter which school district you attend...
For technical support, including Chromebooks and email, please call the BOCES Service Now Helpline at 607-766-3800, or access our

a.span: School Closure Technology Support page for Students & Families.

div.a: New York State of Health - Special Enrollment for Health Insurance Coverage

span.span: With the closure of many businesses across the state, many New Yorkers are at risk of losing their health insurance coverage as a result of COVID-19. Many are likely to be eligible for health insurance with financial assistance through New York State of Health due to loss of coverage/income, and a special enrollment period for people who are uninsured was opened last month.

img.title: Two female school bus drivers for the Vestal Central School District, one holding a laptop as she stands on the steps of a bus and the other in the drivers seat, prepare to deliver Chrome books to students at home.

span.span: Vestal School Bus Drivers deliver Chromebooks to students at home.

Please see a list of child care sites with availability in Broome County. Per New York State requirements, this listing will be updated as information is received from Broome County. In addition, there is a link to a parent need survey, and the results are shared with the Office of Family & Child Services.

strong.span: All Vestal Central School District buildings continue to be closed to the public until at least May 15. If you need assistance, please click the article link to access Department or Building emails that you can use to contact the appropriate resource.

div.a: Rock On Cafe Food Distribution Locations

div.span: For students ages 18 and younger, Food Services are prepared to provide student meals at designated pick-up locations throughout Broome and parts of Tioga Counties. Click the article link to see a schedule of "
Grab & Go" pick-up days/times from April 13 - 17.

div.a: With School Closure, all school-related activities on hiatus

span.span: With the State of Emergency declared by Broome County Executive Jason Garnar on March 14, and a subsequent order extended by Governor Cuomo, Broome County schools are closed until May 15, 2020. All
school-related activities are also canceled or postponed during this period.

div.span: April is National Child Abuse Prevention Month

span.span: Our school counselors wanted to remind you that April is
. Strong, nurturing communities that are supportive of families can get involved and play a role in preventing child abuse and neglect, as well as promoting well-being.

a.span: Visit the Child Welfare Information Gateway

span.span: to learn how you can help.
